title.native: 京都アニメーションCM「発想編」

description: Kyoto Animation commercial.

title.native: 京都アニメーションCM「メガネ編」

description: Kyoto Animation commercial for the light novel series Kyoukai no Kanata.

title.native: 京都アニメーションCM「傘編」

description: Kyoto Animation commercial.

title.native: 京都アニメーションCM「水泳編」

description: Kyoto Animation commercial that aired during episode 10 of Tamako Market.

title.english: Stella Women's Academy, High School Division Class C3
title.native: ステラ女学院高等科C³部（しーきゅーぶ）

description:
Yura Yamato has just arrived at the high school division of Stella Women's Academy, when Sonora Kashima invites her to join a club called "C³". Sonora is the third-year student who became the new head of this club for military survival games. The other members include two second-year students (part-Japanese Karila Hatsuse and G36K-wielding Honoka Mutsu) and two other new students (Rento Kirishima whose family runs a Japanese sweets shop and the really short Yachiyo Hinata).

(Source: Anime News Network)

title.romaji: Tokurei Sochi Dantai Stella Jogakuin Koutou-ka C³-bu
title.english: Preferential Measure Organization Stella Women's Academy

title.native: イケナイBOY

description:
An anime adaptation of the erotic manga "Ikenai Boy" by Yoshihiro Suma, serialized in Business Jump.

Our hero is the typical young energetic college boy, but he got a special gift. He has "magic hands" that puts all women in ecstasy. Obviously he is taking advantage of this gift by meeting one bishoujo after the other!

title.romaji: Ikenai BOY: Ikasu Maruhi Hand Power
Ikenai BOY: Ikasu Maruhi Hand Power
title.native: イケナイＢＯＹ イカす（秘）ハンドパワー

description: Sequel of Ikenai Boy.

title.english: A Good Librarian Like a Good Shepherd
title.native: 大図書館の羊飼い

description:
The story is set at Shiomi Academy, a vast, prestigious academy with a Daitoshokan (literally, "great library") that rivals Japan's national library. As a member of the Library Club, Kyoutarou Kakei goes to Daitoshokan to enjoy reading by himself. He then meets a second-year girl named Tsugumi Shirasaki through the efforts of a so-called "shepherd" who fulfills people's wishes. Eventually, more girls join the club thanks to the "shepherd."

(Source: Anime News Network)

title.english: A Good Librarian Like a Good Shepherd Picture Drama

title.native: 犬とハサミは使いよう

description:
Harumi Kazuhito could spend days at a time with his head buried in his beloved books, and little would make him happier than perusing the pages of his favorite author. Unfortunately, when Harumi gets himself killed, he inexplicably finds himself reincarnated as a dog… which might not be so bad if he could read, or his new owner didn't have the unfortunate twin predilections of playing with scissors and tormenting her new pet! But what truly makes this strange reincarnation the worst of all possible worlds is that she's also his FAVORITE AUTHOR! The horror! Can Harumi find a way to live with this tantrum throwing typist, or will her crazed clippings prove to be his undoing? Can he escape her constant hounding via the doggy door, or is he barking up the wrong tree? There's a rough, rough time ahead as canine compulsive readers and literary she-wolves get snippy with each other when doggies do what they gotta do!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

title.native: ピンクのカーテン

description:
Based on the same-name erotic slice-of-life manga by George Akiyama, serialized in Weekly Manga Goraku.

Virgin boy Okuyama is a stocker at the supermarket who has no luck with women. His life is thrown upside down when his sister Noriko unexpectedly moves into his house. Okuyama is overcome with lustful thoughts for her, but she regards him simply as a brother.

(Source: AnimeVice)

title.romaji: Seito Shokun! Kokoro ni Midori no Neckerchief wo
title.native: 生徒諸君! 心に緑のネッカチーフを

description:
Based on a shoujo manga "Seito Shokun!" by Shouji Youko, serialized in Kodansha's Shoujo Friend.

Students who do not trust teachers, teachers who give up faith in education, parents who blame schools for their children's misbehavior...

Naoko was at a loss when she was assigned as a new high school teacher. Times have changed and students are no longer easy to control, but she chose not to look away. Instead, Naoko reaches out to try and discover the various issues hidden in the modern education system.

(Source: AniDB)

title.native: インフェルノコップ ファクトファイル

description: There are 12 companion pieces in the forms of "Fact Files" (which expand upon a given character from a corresponding episode) airing shortly after each episode.

title.native: スパロウズホテル

description:
The comedy revolves around Sayuri Satou, the new front desk worker at the Sparrow's Hotel— "the closest hotel to Heaven". Her special features are her large breasts and her skills of assassination. She takes down people who cause trouble in the business hotel with those skills, but she is in fact very unskilled when talking to the male hotel manager, and often bites her tongue.

(Source: Anime News Network)

title.native: 波打際のむろみさん OAD

description: Bundled with the ninth limited-edition volume of the manga.

title.romaji: Nuki Doki! Tenshi to Akuma no Sakusei Battle
title.native: ヌキどきッ! ~天使と悪魔の搾精バトル~

description:
Based on the erotic game by Grand Cru Bourgeois.

Angels and Demons like "Naruse Mio" have been fighting for a long time to see who is in charge. In order to bring the closure to this feud. an angel named Sera and a demon named Firika sent to the human world to complete this competition. The leaders of both angels and demons decided that both Angels and Demons had to compete for the love of a human named Yamato. Thus, Sera and Firika compete for Yamato's love and the supremacy of their entire race.

(Source: Nekopoi and Has Been Translated)

title.romaji: Nuki Doki! Revolution: Tenshi to Akuma no Sakusei Battle
Nuki Doki! Tenshi to Akuma no Sakusei Battle

title.native: 四百二十連敗ガール

description: Promotion video for Naruto Kiriyama's light novel Yonhyakunijuu Renpai Girl, commissioned by Enterbrain after Kiriyama won the 14th Entertainment Awards Grand Prize (Entame Taishou) from the publisher's light novel department.

title.romaji: Pocket Monsters Best Wishes! Season 2: Decolora Adventure
title.english: Pokémon BW: Adventures in Unova and Beyond
title.native: ポケットモンスター ベストウイッシュ シーズン２ デコロラアドベンチャー

description: After their encounter with Team Plasma, Satoshi, Iris and Dent start a new journey in the Decolore Islands.

title.romaji: Pocket Monsters Best Wishes! Season 2: Episode N
Pocket Monsters Best Wishes! Season 2: Decolora Adventure Specials
Pocket Monsters Best Wishes! Shinsoku no Genesect: Mewtwo Kakusei
title.english: Pokémon the Movie: Genesect and the Legend Awakened

title.romaji: Papa no Iukoto wo Kikinasai! OVA
title.native: パパのいうことを聞きなさい! OVA

description: Limited edition episode included with pre-orders for the 13th and 18th light novel volumes.

title.romaji: Papa no Iukoto wo Kikinasai!: Pokkapoka

title.native: たまこまーけっと ぺったんこアニメ

description:
Episodes 1-3 focus on Dera welcoming ladies to his bar.
Episodes 4-6 focus on Choi-chan.

title.native: 一輪者 ICHIRIN-SHA

description:
On a planet very similar to the earth... Here, the missile mechanoids started to have its own will and control, and were driving the human beings into serious danger. Shaleen was the last ICHIRIN-SHA (unicyclist) in the world, traveling the world on his beat up motor unicycle. One day, when Shaleen was running from the attacks of the missile mechanoids, he stops by a ghost town and meets a mysterious girl who was constantly targeted by the mechanoids.

Note: Originally meant to be a full length movie, the project was cancelled, but a 7 minutes long trailer was released before that.

(Source: AniDB)

title.native: 涙の蕾

description: An animated music video shown in the NHK program 'Minna no Uta,' sung by CECIL.

title.native: 천방지축 하니

description:
An alternative version of Dalyeolla Hani with minor changes implemented.

Hani is a small tomboy and slightly troublesome teenager who lives life a bit carelessly on her own since her Father lives abroad due to work in the Middle East and her Mother died when she was very small. The only thing Hany is very good at is running~ fast!

(Source: Cute in Korea)

title.native: ゴールデンタイム

description:
Due to a tragic accident, Banri Tada is struck with amnesia, dissolving the memories of his hometown and past. However, after befriending Mitsuo Yanagisawa, he decides to move on and begin a new life at law school in Tokyo. But just as he is beginning to adjust to his college life, the beautiful Kouko Kaga dramatically barges into Banri's life, and their chance meeting marks the beginning of an unforgettable year.

After having a glimpse of college life, Banri learns that he is in a new place and a new world—a place where he can be reborn, to have new friends, fall in love, makes mistakes and grow. And as he begins to discover who he was, the path he has chosen leads him towards a blindingly bright life that he will never want to forget.

title.native: 花は咲く

description: "Hana wa Saku" is a song written by Shunji Iwai and Yoko Kanno to support NHK's reconstruction efforts in the areas hardest hit by the 2011 Great Eastern Japan Earthquake. An animated music video was created in commemoration of the two-year anniversary of the disaster and broadcast on NHK G.

title.romaji: Hana wa Saku: Touhoku ni Saku

title.native: All Alone With You

description: All Alone With You is the fourth single by the music group EGOIST and is used as the second ending theme song of Psycho-Pass. The limited edition release includes a DVD with an animated music video.

title.native: 男樹

description: Based on the seinen manga by Motomiya Hiroshi.

title.native: 有頂天家族

description: In Kyoto, there are three kinds of residents: humans, raccoon dogs, and tengu. Shimogamo Yasaburou is the third son of the Shimogamo raccoon dog family. His father, Souichirou, had been the head of Kyoto raccoon dog community until he was eaten by the human members of "Friday Club". While taking care of old tengu, fighting with other raccoon dogs, and playing with a psychic human girl, Yasaburou approaches the truth of his father's death.

title.native: Redial

description: "Redial" is the title track of livetune's 2013 compilation album Re:Dial featuring Hatsune Miku. An animated music video of the song was included in a limited edition DVD sold with the album.

title.native: ダンボール戦機WARS

description:
Year 2055, 4 years after the events in Danball Senki W. LBXs have become the world’s largest hobby, big enough for pro leagues to be established, and people to make their entire living off being an LBX player. 14-year-old Arata is a new transfer student at Kamui Daimon Integrated Academy on Kamui Island, near Japan. Known to be the most prestigious institution in the world for raising LBX players and mechanics, entrance to the academy requires an extremely competitive hurdle of being the champion of at least 3 official tournaments. Along with other members of his platoon, they face rivals and delve into the secrets lurking within the academy.

(Source: Anime News Network)

title.native: 放課後のプレアデス

description: Subaru is a young girl who discovers that her best friend Aoi is part of a magical group trying to gather engine fragments so that a little being from Pleiades can return to his home. Subaru considers joining them as she was chosen by the Pleiadian, president of this afterschool club.

title.native: ピューと吹く！ジャガー

description:
Based on the gag manga written and illustrated by Usuta Kyousuke that ran in Shuukan Shounen Jump from 2000 to 2010.

(Source: AniDB)

title.romaji: Pyuu to Fuku! Jaguar: Ima, Fuki ni Yukimasu

title.native: 魔法少女リリカルなのはReflection

description:
A pair of researchers remain on their dying planet of Eltria with their two daughters, Amitie and Kirie, in hopes of finding a way to revive the planet, but it was no use. Against her older sister's wishes, Kirie sets off with her childhood friend Iris to seek help from a distant alternate world. They arrive in Japan on Earth to search for the key to their planet's regeneration.

(Source: Anime News Network)

title.romaji: Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha: The MOVIE 2nd A's
title.english: Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha: The Movie 2nd A's

title.romaji: Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha: Reflection the Comics

title.native: The Everlasting Guilty Crown

description: The Everlasting Guilty Crown is the second single by the music group EGOIST and is used as the second opening theme song of Guilty Crown. The limited edition release includes a DVD with a music video of the song's TV edit, animated in 3D CGI.

title.romaji: Hello Kitty no London ni Orita Uchuujin
title.native: ハローキティのロンドンにおりた宇宙人

description: In this original story by Hoshiyama Hiroyuki, Kitty White hears from friends about recent UFO sightings and goes to inspect one of the UFO crash sites, to learn more about it and the aliens that came with it.

title.romaji: Tetsuwan Atom: Atom Tanjou no Himitsu
title.native: 鉄腕アトム　アトム誕生の秘密

description:
Doctor Tenma, chief of the Ministry of Science, brought a digital brain genome from an aircraft. Doctor Tenma begins a trip to Mars, then combines the genome with a robot. Doctor Tenma's son, Tobio, who had died in a traffic accident, has been revived.

(Source: AstroBoy Online)

title.romaji: Tetsuwan Atom: Chikyuu Saigo no Hi
title.native: 鉄腕アトム ~地球最後の日~

description:
Astro Boy, helping Professor Ochinomizu with planetary exploration, discovers a trash star floating in space. On this star, robots that can no longer move have been thrown away stacked on top of each other. On this robot mountain, Astro saves a robot soldier, Bemu, that escaped from the verge of death and takes him back to Earth.

"I'm tried of fighting!" "I feel the same." While Atom and Bemu are together, a warm friendship is born and goes on to deepen. However, one day, the trash star draws near to the Earth. If it hits, the Earth would have a huge explosion. The Earth is in chaos. As this happens, there is just one way to stop the crash into Earth. Only this is... What will Astro do. Will he be able to protect a peaceful Earth as well as his friendship with Bemu?

(Source: Astro Boy Wiki)

title.romaji: Tetsuwan Atom Tokubetsu-hen: Kagayakeru Hoshi - Anata wa Aoku, Utsukushii...
title.native: Tetsuwan Atom 鉄腕アトム 特別編: 輝ける地球 ~あなたは青く、美しい...~

description:
Another Tetsuwan Atom Movie that was shown in the Tezuka Osamu World Cinema in Tokyo until it was closed in 2011.

(Source: AniDB)

title.romaji: Tetsuwan Atom: Ao Kishi no Kan
title.native: 鉄腕アトム ~青騎士の巻~

description:
The film begins with the Phoenix retelling the tales and hopes of Astro Boy. Many of the visual being directly taken from the 1980s TV series as it recaps some of his adventures.

Following this recap, Astro Boy confronts Blue Bon and tries to convince him to change his mind about the humans. But Blue Bon misunderstands, assuming that if Astro Boy does not agree then he is an enemy. Blue Bon hates humans because they broke apart his family (Maria and Tonto). A battle begins between the two after Astro Boy fails to convince Blue Bon that they aren't each others' enemy.

(Source: Astro Boy Wiki)

title.native: 探検ドリランド-1000年の真宝-

description:
1,000 years after Princess Mikoto's era, all hunters have been sealed into cards due to a certain incident in the past. Adventurous boy Hagan becomes the key to freeing these sealed hunters, and travels along with his friends to find these cards, sometimes facing treacherous battles.

(Source: Anime News Network)

title.romaji: Kiki to Lala no Hakuchouza no Ohime-sama
title.native: キキとララの白鳥座のお姫さま

description: In this episode, Kiki and Lala are learning about stars and constellations, and even meeting the Queen of Stars herself.

title.romaji: Kiki to Lala no Ohime-sama ni Naritai
Kiki to Lala no Papa to Mama ni Aitai
title.native: キキとララのパパとママにあいたい

description: This is one of the happiest days for Kiki and Lala as they receive a present sent to them by their parents.

title.romaji: Kiki to Lala no Ohime-sama ni Naritai
Kiki to Lala no Hoshi no Dance Shoes
title.native: キキとララの星のダンスシューズ

description: It's dancing time for Kiki and Lala.

title.romaji: Kiki to Lala no Ohime-sama ni Naritai
Kero Kero Keroppi no Christmas Eve no Okurimono

title.romaji: Kero Kero Keroppi no Boku-tachi no Takaramono
title.native: けろけろけろっぴのぼくたちのたからもの

title.romaji: Super Real Mahjong: Mahjong Battle Scramble - Konran-teki Sento Mahjong
title.native: 麻雀バトルスクランブル 混乱的戦斗麻雀 (スーパーリアル麻雀／麻雀バトルスクランブル)

description:
Sequel of Super Real Mahjong.

Mahjong-playing sisters Kasumi, Miki, and Shouko are sent to a world where mahjong tiles are currency. In order to return to their world, they must defeat a mahjong-playing rabbit who rules the land.

title.romaji: Super Real Mahjong: Kasumi Miki Shouko no Hajimemashite
Super Real Mahjong: Kasumi Miki Shouko no Hajimemashite
title.native: スーパーリアル麻雀 ミキ・カスミ・ショーコのはじめまして (スーパーリアル麻雀／かすみ・ミキ・ショー子のはじめまして)

description: An anime based on characters from the strip mahjong arcade game "Super Real Mahjong 2".

title.romaji: Super Real Mahjong: Mahjong Battle Scramble - Konran-teki Sento Mahjong

title.native: フリージング ヴァイブレーション

description: Second season of Freezing.

title.romaji: Thermae Romae: Thermae Romae x TOTO Collaboration
title.native: テルマエ・ロマエｘ TOTO企業コラボレーション

description: Lucius ends up at the presentation of bathroom and toilet equipment by Japanese toilet manufacturer TOTO, where he learns about the most recent technological advances in that field.

title.native: フォルツァ！ひでまる

description:
A soccer anime with a cast of wacky animals in sports getup seems far out of its time in the early 21st century, but it was the year of the World Cup in Japan and South Korea, and the very young audience sees these tropes with fresh eyes. Hidemaru is a feisty fox; his friends include bunnies, dogs, horses, and a couple of hefty hippo girls.

Based on a manga Hidemaru the Soccer Boy by Makoto Mizobuchi, serialized in CoroCoro Comics.

(Source: AnimeVice)

title.romaji: Hello Kitty no Happy! Kasou Taikai
title.native: ハローキティのハッピー!仮装大会
